HEAD OFFICE: 122, LEADENHALL STREET, LONDON , E .C. 3. TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS: GRATUITY, LONDON. BRANC BUSREH. AMARAH. KUT. KHORAMSHAHR. ABADAN AHWAZ . BANDAR SHAHPOUR. BUSHIRE. BUNDER -ABBAS. HES' BAHREIN . KOWEIT. DUBAI . SHARJAH . MUSCAT. RAS TANURA. EL KHOBAR. RAS EL MISHAAB. LINGAH . IN REPLY PLEASE QUOTE no OS/325 Bahrein, 22nd March 19 50* H.M.B.Political Agency, BAHREIN. Dear Sir, S.S.»CITY OF CHELMSFORD” We are enclosing herewith articles for the above vessel which please return to bearer after duly endorsing. For your information, we would advise that the above vessel arrived at this port on the 17th instant and as far as we are aware, there is no change in ship^ crew. JDC. y ^ . '■ rf' /tj* Mr ^ 4-^ itZ A: imf* 4 ■ f-4-^■HHi © Political Agency, Bahrain, 25th March 1950 It is noticed from your letter OS/325 dated the 22nd March 1950 that the s.s. w CIT5T OF CHELMSFORD' arrived at this port on the 17th instant but the ship^ articles form (Eng.l) was deposited with this Agency by your representative on the 22nd March 1950 and taken away again the same day. Although admittedly this practice has been in vogue here for some time it is not consistent with Section 257(1) of the Merchant Shipping Act which is reproduced below:- 'Whenever a ship, in whatever part of Her Majesty’s dominions it is registered (except a ship whose business for the time being is to carry passengers whether cabin or steerage passengers), arrives at a port in a British possession or at a port elsewhere at which there is a British consular officer, and remains thereat for forty-eight hours, the master shall, within forty-eight hours of the ship's arrival, deliver to the chief officer of customs or to the consular officer (as the case may be) the agreement v/ith the crew, and also all indentures and assignments of apprenticeships, or, if the ship is registered in a British possession,such of those documents as the ship is provided with'. I shall be glad if in future the above instruc tions are complied with. The documents will be kept in this Agency during the ship's stay in the port and returned within a reasonable time before its departure to your representative (who should come and collect them) after making the necessary endorsement on payment of the relevant fee. Yours faithfully, for Political Agent The Manager, Messrs.Gray Mackenzie A Co.Ltd., Bahrain. —*Gray, Mackenzie & Co.L td (INCORPORATED IN ENGLAND) TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS (ALL BRANCHES). GRAY. B ahrein, 17th Apr il 19 50 The Political Agent, BAHREIN. Dear Sir, S. S« n AKMANISTAN n We enclose herewith articles for the above vessel which arrived at this port on the 7th instant and sailed for Umm Said 11th April 1950. The above named vessel returned from Umm Said on the 13th instant, and we estimate to sail from this port on or about 22nd instant. Please return attached articles duly endorsed# by you on or about 21st instant. Enel: ENG/l form. Lascar form. Eng/l form. CO.LTD.d) Gray, Mackenzie & Co. Ltd. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘File 12/20 Correspondence regarding ships articles deposited with the Agency’

physicalDescription.extent: The file’s contents are arranged in approximate chronological order, from the earliest item at the front to the latest at the end. The file notes at the end of the file (f 34) mirror the chronological arrangement.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 35; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file chiefly comprises letters received by the Political Agency from Gray, Mackenzie and Company, enclosing articles from vessels at Bahrain, for endorsement by the Agency. Most of the letters have dated handwritten notes, usually made by the Assistant Political Agent (A.P.A.), confirming that the endorsements had been signed. The file also contains a single letter from the Political Agent at Bahrain, to Gray, Mackenzie and Company, dated 25 March 1950, noting that articles received from the SS City of Chelmsfordwere deposited at the Agency forty-eight hours after the vessel’s arrival at port, in contravention of Section 257(1) of the Shipping Act (quoted in the Agent’s letter, f 4).

name.namePart: Gray, Mackenzie and Company Limited, shipping agents
